alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Ford; Grundy; Iroquois; Kankakee; Kendall; La Salle; Livingston; Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued January 10 at 2:57PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Elevated river levels possible this weekend followed by increased risk for river ice and ice jams late this weekend through next week... Rainfall is possible on Friday and Saturday which may cause rises on rivers and streams to near bankfull through the weekend. By late weekend, temperatures will become very favorable for river ice development and possible ice jams, impacting the Fox, Des Plaines, Kankakee, Iroquois, and Vermilion river basins. The risk for ice jams is expected to continue through next week. Rapid formation of river ice on rivers and tributaries may begin as early as Sunday and Monday. Ice jams will be possible, especially along the Kankakee and Iroquois rivers. River ice is expected to remain in place for at least several days while cold temperatures continue. Ice jams may cause rises on area rivers with little warning. This outlook means that elevated water levels and potential impacts are possible, but not yet certain. Persons with interests along area rivers should closely monitor the latest forecasts. This product will be updated by tomorrow afternoon.

area.areaDesc: Cook; DuPage; Ford; Grundy; Iroquois; Kankakee; Kendall; La Salle; Livingston; Will
